name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Indianapolis-Downtown

reviews.text: The young man at the front desk when we checked in was not friendly at all and looked at the clock and then seemed to reluctantly look to see if our room was ready. It was two and check-in is listed at four, but most hotels will let you check in a little early. And being in downtown Indy we were really wanting to just park our car and do a little shopping. He said our room was not available and was not very helpful in explaining parking, etc. Fortunately a great lady from the back came running forward and told him he could switch us with another room and we could check in right away. He might have been new. But he did not seem happy at all with our being there at two. The room was gorgeous. The beds are amazing. The suite is huge with a full kitchen, a living area with a flat screen tv. This is a building renovated from two old warehouses and still has much of the charm from the old building with huge ceilings.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — Front desk clerk was not the friendliest

reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!!
reviews.text: We were going to a concert to see Neil Diamond at Conseco and this hotel was just a very short walk to Conseco. It is also a very short walk to the downtown Center City Mall. There are many restaurants near the hotel but also many bars. There are homeless people around this area often. But you feel very safe inside the hotel.

They have an amazing evening reception during the week. This is really a full meal with salad, and entree, a vegetable, hot cookies, etc. They serve wine and beer with this or lemonade. Victor was amazing. He brought cookies to us right from the oven. We had sweet-n-sour chicken that night. Some nights they even have beef wellington. They also have a very nice hot breakfast in the morning. Victor was so nice and truly seemed to love his job.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Parking is either valet or self-park at the Union Station parking garage just about a block from the hotel. It is not included with the room rate. If you self park it is 18.00. I think the valet service is 22.00.
reviews.title: Loved It! Cant wait to go back!

reviews.text: This location was perfect for our concert. And the staff, except for the first young man were all so great. The valets, housekeeping, etc, were all very, very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read the reviews and chose to stay there over Indy 500 Pole Day weekend. My husband & I both agreed it was one of the top hotels we've ever stayed in. The charm of the exposed brick & beams and very tall ceilings were amazing. Very comfortable and spacious. It was also within walking distance to some excellent restaurants! My only complaint is that the noise from the nightclub next door was distracting. I woke up several times to the noise. I would have asked to switch rooms, but we were already unpacked and in bed. Be sure to request a room away from that side of the building or bring a white noise machine with you!
reviews.title: A+ Choice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great. The building was transformed from a warehouse in 2006 to a very nice hotel with spacious rooms that include full size frig and stove top. The interior brick is original to the old warehouse building. Conseco Field House is 1 1/2 blocks, as well as many restaurants and shopping. Indianapolis has a great downtown. The only downside was the street people that seemed to be on most corners.
reviews.title: Great Downtown Indy Hotel Choice
Most impressive rooms we have experienced in a long time
reviews.text: Situated in the heart of Downtown Indianapolis and stone's throw away from many excellent restaurants etc...It was easy to (find with a GPS) and Valet Parking was easy to take advantage of at relatively reasonable price ($22).
Check in: easy; clerk perfectly competent if not effusively friendly and also helpful with directions to restaurants.
reviews.title: The nicest hotel I have ever stayed in!!

reviews.text: Room: Advertised as a suite (2 queen beds, 1BR), it's really a huge loft with high ceilings : this might be an issue if privacy is wanted (i.e., travelling family). We were on a low floor and could definitely hear the street sounds into the wee hours of the morning: not a huge deal as we had earplugs, but this might be a problem for some. Pool: warm and fun for kids. Fitness center: small but ok. Business center: beautiful a la national geographics explorer's club. Bfast was free so can't complain about the relatively mediocre but adequate offerings.
reviews.title: Great loft living

reviews.text: I travel to Indianapolis every month for business. I usually stay at the Conrad or the Hilton. Neither were available in my budget for my June trip so I opted to try the Homewood Suites. I am so happy that they were not available because I had the best experience at the Homewood Suites. The employees couldn't do enough for you. The valet was super helpful and even drove me to a meeting a few blocks away so I wouldn't have to carry a large box in a dress and heels. They all remembered my name! I've stayed at the Conrad at least a dozen times and they NEVER remember me. I have to use the valet quite a bit because I have meetings downtown and north so I'm always getting my car. Usually I have to wait 10-15 minutes at the Conrad. I never waited more than 5 at the Homewood Suites. I loved my room. It was large enough for me to practice yoga and had a great area for my laptop and work stuff. The bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed that I could also stretch out on the couch and read. The free breakfast was perfect for me. They could offer more fruit but I got enough to get my day going. Going forward I will always stay at the Homewood Suites. It will be my Indianapolis home away from home.
reviews.title: Preferred Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed two nights with wife for leisure. Pros are 1) location - just blocks from the Circle with all the shopping, restaurants and clubs (consider Slippery Noodle for blues). 2) large rooms - not true two room suites with door between but quite large with two TVs. 3) relatively new and nice. 4) kitchenette if you need that. Cons 1) management inept - we were out of our room from 10A to 4P, returned for a nap before dinner only to find still no maid service. Apparently housekeeping starts on the first floor and works their way up (we were on 5). Hotel not near full (? 1/3 at most) so seems they could have gotten to stay overs sooner - maybe this is the most efficient/economical way to do it but unacceptable in our eyes, you may not agree, but major issue for us. 2) elevator very slow and no front stairwell. 3) Wood area in kitchenette sticky both days - ? mop. 4) Returned to room after maid left and dishwasher running - one water glass we had used in it total - so much for economical. 5) breakfast is included in room charge but other than ubiquitous self made waffles the hot portion was pretty rough sledding - plan on continental. 5) may want to rename it the Homeless Suites. Sadly on way to Circle there were 4-5 beggars all the time. Hadn't noted this in Indy before - ? maybe the time of year. Room noise others have noted not a problem on 5th floor but with the poor maid service and really slow elevator (can't imagine if it had been close to full) would avoid top floor. Otherwise hotel reasonable choice for downtown.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad - you decide

reviews.text: Stayed at this property along with a friend and my 2 adult daughters. We were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful spacious room which included high ceilings, small kitchen with dishes and utensils, etc. There were two t.v.'s and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. We also used the sofa bed which was very comfortable .Noise is a problem, but we were able to sleep. Breakfast was good with the usual choices and hotel is within walking distance to many great restaurants and indoor mall. We paid $189.00 per night and was unable to get a lower price. The small store in poorly stocked and very expensive. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful hotel, comfortable beds

reviews.text: Hotel is great, rooms are great, pool is great, location is great -- unless you stay on a Saturday night. The problem: The street directly in front of the hotel is a gathering place for extremely loud motorcycle riders who rev their engines and race down Meridian street all night -- apparently with the Indy police department's blessing. The noise is so bad that the hotel should have warned us in advance. What otherwise would have been a great stay was ruined because the hotel failed in its essential purpose -- we could not sleep.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay on Saturday Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely the best value we could find downtown. The room we stayed in came with a furnished kitchenette and pull out sofa bed, which enabled us to entertain friends while we visited. The location was surprisingly quiet for its location near several popular bars in town. (I don't know what other reviewers were talking about when they complained about noise from outside.) The only disappointment was that our window faced a wall. When we decided to add a third night to our stay, the hotel staff booked us at our original discounted rate before we even had a chance to ask for it.
reviews.title: best value for downtown
Good Hotel, but not that great
reviews.text: If you read the other reviews, you would think this hotel is perfect. However, there are some concerns: 1) valet parking is $22 per day and there are really no other options close by. 2) I had a fax sent, and they lost it, so it had to be resent. 3) At 2 PM in the afternoon, my room was not really. The good stuff is: 1) rooms are very nice, the hotel is new. 2) It is located in a quiet area of the downtown. 3) the evening reception is OK.
There are other options in the downtown area. Maybe the Hilton would be a good choice.
reviews.title: loved it except for the noise

reviews.text: Beautiful rooms with modern decor and above average room additions (full fridge, dishwasher etc) Comfortable beds with huge loft style rooms. Exceptional customer service...
reviews.title: Blown away by this Homewood Suites
Amazing rooms in downtown Indy
reviews.text: However if you are a light sleeper be weary of the fact that you are downtown and right next to a night club open until 3am in the morning. The bass resonates through the rooms if you are so unfortunate to be on the side next to the club. We were there during the Indy GP races and mistook the noise as part of nightly festivities...after three nights of little sleep and a complaint to the night manager we were moved to a better location, still some noise but tolerable.
There is no room service but the central location as well as breakfast/light supper provided make up for that.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Indy

likes.liked: — Very nice decor for fairly cheap

aka: Homewood Suites Indianapolis - Downtown Hotel Indianapolis
